item.title: my brother
item.description: i had a little brother who was misunderstood he would color in the corner when things were going good when things turned bad or he got mad you’d better stay away he would try real hard to be like me but somewhere lost his way after prison he went really bad now he is gone for good i miss him still

item.title: happy to be unhappy
item.description: sitting bored is killing me obviously i don’t mind wouldn’t i get up and go why do i keep sitting here i can’t keep doing this i am not happy here it is time to go

item.title: starting
item.description: staring at a blank page is uncomfortable how to bring it to life will it ever reach it’s potential ideas that danced through my mind moments ago left town in a hurry didn’t leave a forwarding address my mind wanders like a drunk in a dark alley bouncing off the hard edges maybe this page is destined for the dumpster

item.title: au·thor
item.description: does it really matter? i am just one of over seven billion people living on this little blue/green planet with you. since you aren’t planning to get me a gift for my birthday…it doesn’t really matter how young/old i am. residing in america means that i am equal no matter the color of my skin…so unless you are a bigot my race shouldn’t be important. chances are good that we have never slept together and probably won’t in the near future…so my sex, gender, orientation and preferences aren’t really your concern.
